document.heading: Mortgage Lender and Broker Act of 1996 Temporary Amendment Act of 1997

history.narrative: Law 12-3, the “Mortgage Lender and Broker Act of 1996 Temporary Amendment Act of 1997,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-82. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 4, 1997, and March 4, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 19, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-45 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-3 became effective on May 23, 1997.
